quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.
quotes.title: The Crack-Up

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
quotes.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
quotes.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.quote: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.
quotes.title: Danse Macabre

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: In a time of deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
quotes.title: War and Peace

quotes.author: Virgil
quotes.quote: Fortune favors the brave.
quotes.title: The Aeneid

quotes.author: Harper Lee
quotes.quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.
quotes.title: To Kill a Mockingbird

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
quotes.title: Pride and Prejudice

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, Or to take arms against a sea of troubles.
quotes.title: Hamlet

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
quotes.title: A Farewell to Arms

quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
quotes.title: The Elephant Man

quotes.author: Agatha Christie
quotes.quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have; the older she gets the more interested he is in her.
quotes.title: Murder on the Orient Express

quotes.author: William Faulkner
quotes.quote: The past is never dead. It's not even past.
quotes.title: Requiem for a Nun

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.quote: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
quotes.title: Fahrenheit 451

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.quote: We are what we believe we are.
quotes.title: Mere Christianity

quotes.author: John Steinbeck
quotes.quote: The free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world.
quotes.title: East of Eden

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
quotes.title: A Tale of Two Cities

quotes.author: E.L. James
quotes.quote: Laters, baby.
quotes.title: Fifty Shades of Grey

quotes.author: Aldous Huxley
quotes.quote: The greatest triumphs of propaganda have been accomplished, not by doing something, but by refraining from doing.
quotes.title: Brave New World

quotes.author: Margaret Atwood
quotes.quote: War is what happens when language fails.
quotes.title: The Handmaid's Tale

quotes.author: Roald Dahl
quotes.quote: A little nonsense now and then is cherished by the wisest men.
quotes.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

quotes.author: J.D. Salinger
quotes.quote: What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it.
quotes.title: The Catcher in the Rye

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
quotes.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: Hope. It is the only thing stronger than fear.
quotes.title: The Hunger Games

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
quotes.title: The Great Gatsby

quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quotes.quote: All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
quotes.title: The Lord of the Rings

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.
